title: Modeling a Periodic Context-Jump Rope, Part C

content.question: Part C Refer to the graph of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> in part (A). The <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>-coordinate of <math alttext="G"><mi>G</mi></math> is <math alttext="t subscript 1"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and the <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>-coordinate of <math alttext="J"><mi>J</mi></math> is <math alttext="t subscript 2"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. (i) On the interval <math alttext="open parentheses t subscript 1 comma t subscript 2 close parentheses"> <mfenced> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> </math>, which of the following is true about <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>? <math alttext="h"> <mi>h</mi> </math> is positive and increasing. <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is positive and decreasing. <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is negative and increasing. <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is negative and decreasing. (ii) Describe how the rate of change of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is changing on the interval <math alttext="open parentheses t subscript 1 comma t subscript 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>.

frqParts.text: Part C Refer to the graph of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> in part (A). The <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>-coordinate of <math alttext="G"><mi>G</mi></math> is <math alttext="t subscript 1"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and the <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>-coordinate of <math alttext="J"><mi>J</mi></math> is <math alttext="t subscript 2"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. (ii) Describe how the rate of change of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is changing on the interval <math alttext="open parentheses t subscript 1 comma t subscript 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
